main event: An elongated, metallic-colored object was sighted in the sky over Hertford, North Carolina on April 5, 1950.
interesting points: The object was described as being longer than an airplane but slimmer, and colored a dark metallic gray.
The object dipped slightly and then continued on a southwesterly course, disappearing from sight in about five minutes.
Witnesses described the object as being about the size of a large airliner but shaped differently, more like a cigar or a submarine than a conventional aircraft.
The object traveled at a steady speed and gave no indication of wavering or zigzagging in its course.
A similar object was sighted over Woodland, about 20 miles to the southwest of Hertford, on the same day, with almost identical descriptions.
witnesses: a group of school children, W. Clyde Garrett, Jake Farrell, Mrs. Garland Warren, Bob Hobson, Mrs. Hobson, and Mr. and Mrs. Earl Martin
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
